Articles.Content:
So, I am trying to import KSPparttools and correct textmeshpro into the correct unity (checked all of this before asking), but, upon import, I get these warning messages: 

Error: Could not load signature of KSPFontAsset:.ctor due to: Could not load file or assembly 'TextMeshPro-2017.1-1.0.56-Runtime, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. assembly:TextMeshPro-2017.1-1.0.56-Runtime, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null type:<unknown type> member:(null) signature:<none>

 

Unloading broken assembly Assets/Plugins/KSPAssets/KSPAssetCompiler.dll, this assembly can cause crashes in the runtime

 

please help me!
Moved over to Add-on Dev sub forum.   Good luck with your issue.

Thank you.  did not realize the mistake.  I have since figured out what was happening, but, following the current method shown in the following link, I found that Unity does not work the same as it did in 2013.  I am now having trouble trying to set up the part I am working with for export and need some help!

idk if mebbe this might help? vOv
I've just been ignoring the TM Pro errs... vOv

https://makaka.org/unity-tutorials/textmesh-pro-vs-unity-2018-2
